00008 // Protected Linked List
00009 // *** perhaps use a real template definition if that
00010 //     means every type that uses it can reuse the
00011 //     same function code
00012 //
00013 // A linked list with protection against breakage and floating remnants,
00014 // which is also type-safe by using define to create type-specific
00015 // code instead of type-casting from generic code.
00016 // a - Protected Linked List parameters and functions, add these
00017 //     to the class header
00018 #define Protected_Linked_List(PLLType) \
00019         protected: \
00020                 PLLType * next, * prev; \
00021         public: \
00022                 PLLType * Next() { return next; } \
00023                 PLLType * Prev() { return prev; } \
00024                 inline bool insert_this_after(PLLType * pred); \
00025                 inline bool insert_this_before(PLLType * succ); \
00026                 inline bool insert_after_this(PLLType * nsrt); \
00027                 inline bool insert_before_this(PLLType * nsrt); \
00028                 inline PLLType * el(int n); \
00029                 inline PLLType * PLLType::head(); \
00030                 inline PLLType * PLLType::tail(); \
00031                 inline int length(); \
00032                 inline int fulllength()
00033 // b - Protected Linked List destructor component, add this to
00034 //     the class destructor
00035 #define Protected_Linked_List_destructor \
00036         delete next
00037 // c - Protected Linked List constructor component, add this to
00038 //     the class constructor headers
00039 #define Protected_Linked_List_constructor \
00040         prev(NULL), next(NULL)
00041 // d - Protected Linked List inline functions, add this after
00042 //     the class
00043 //              insert_this_*() returns true if linked, false if first topic in new list
00044 //              el() returns the nth offset element in the linked list (either direction)
00045 ...change so that existing links are not broken when inserting
00046 #define Protected_Linked_List_functions(PLLType) \
00047         inline bool PLLType::insert_this_after(PLLType * pred) { \
00048                 if (!pred) { \
00049                         next = NULL; \
00050                         prev = NULL; \
00051                         return false; \
00052                 } \
00053                 prev = pred; \
00054                 next = pred->Next(); \
00055                 pred->insert_after_this(this); \
00056                 if (next) next->insert_before_this(this); \
00057                 return true; \
00058         } \
00059         inline bool PLLType::insert_this_before(PLLType * succ) { \
00060                 if (!succ) { \
00061                         next = NULL; \
00062                         prev = NULL; \
00063                         return false; \
00064                 } \
00065                 next = succ; \
00066                 prev = succ->Prev(); \
00067                 succ->insert_before_this(this); \
00068                 if (prev) prev->insert_after_this(this); \
00069                 return true; \
00070         } \
00071         inline bool PLLType::insert_after_this(PLLType * nsrt) { \
00072                 if (!nsrt) return false; \
00073                 if (nsrt->Prev()!=this) nsrt->insert_this_after(this); \
00074                 else next = nsrt; \
00075                 return true; \
00076         } \
00077         inline bool PLLType::insert_before_this(PLLType * nsrt) { \
00078                 if (!nsrt) return false; \
00079                 if (nsrt->Next()!=this) nsrt->insert_this_before(this); \
00080                 else prev = nsrt; \
00081                 return true; \
00082         } \
00083         inline PLLType * PLLType::el(int n) { \
00084                 if (!n) return this; \
00085                 if (n>0) { \
00086                         if (next) return next->el(n-1); \
00087                         else return NULL; \
00088                 } else { \
00089                         if (prev) return prev->el(n+1); \
00090                         else return NULL; \
00091                 } \
00092         } \
00093         inline PLLType * PLLType::head() { \
00094                 if (!prev) return this; \
00095                 return prev->head(); \
00096         } \
00097         inline PLLType * PLLType::tail() { \
00098                 if (!next) return this; \
00099                 return next->tail(); \
00100         } \
00101         inline int PLLType::length() { \
00102                 if (Next()) return 1 + Next()->length(); \
00103                 return 1; \
00104         } \
00105         inline int PLLType::fulllength() { \
00106                 return head()->length(); \
00107         }
00108 // e - Protected Linked List macro that can be used to
00109 //     access functions in linked elements at a relative
00110 //     distance n from an element
00111 #define Protected_Linked_List_Indexed_Access(PLLType,Here,There) \
00112         if (!n) return Here; \
00113         if (PLLType * e = el(n)) return e->There; else return NULL
00114 
00115 #endif
00116 // f - Protected Linked List macro that loops forward through
00117 //     linked elements contingent upon a test, providing the
00118 //     pointer e to the current element
00119 #define PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(PLLType,Init_El,Extra_Test) \
00120         for (PLLType * e = Init_El; ((e) && (Extra_Test)); e = e->Next())
